intro: Synaphea brachyceras, commonly known as the narrow-headed synaphea, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate fronds that are often densely packed. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with a short, stout rhizome and tightly arranged, linear leaves. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found in temperate forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
